DADOS-GERAIS.NOME-EM-CITACOES-BIBLIOGRAFICAS: SANTOS, Jeeves L.;LOPES DOS SANTOS, JEEVES;DOS SANTOS, JEEVES LOPES

RESUMO-CV.TEXTO-RESUMO-CV-RH: Formado em Engenharia Eltrica, com nfase em eletrnica, Mestre na rea de Controle de Sistemas Dinmicos e Doutor na rea de Dispositivos e Sistemas Eletrnicos, ambos pelo Instituto Tecnolgico de Aeronutica - ITA. Atuao profissional voltada para o desenvolvimento de Sistemas de Controle de Potncia, com nfase em gerenciamento de energia, eficincia energtica, incluindo sistemas de propulso hbrida (eltrica/combusto) e eltrica, envolvendo: 1) Modelagem, 2) Simulao, 3) Desenvolvimento de Sistemas Embarcados, 4) Testes utilizando "Model In the Loop" e "Hardware In the Loop". Tem um profundo interesse na aplicao de mtodos de inteligncia Artificial e nos elementos que compe a engenharia mecatrnica, como eletrnica, controle, computao e sistemas embarcados em geral.

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-TRABALHO.TITULO-DO-TRABALHO: Gait Synthesis of a Hybrid Legged Robot Using Reinforcement Learning
DADOS-BASICOS-DO-TRABALHO.TITULO-DO-TRABALHO-INGLES: Gait Synthesis of a Hybrid Legged Robot Using Reinforcement Learning

AUTORES.NOME-PARA-CITACAO: SANTOS, Jeeves L.;LOPES DOS SANTOS, JEEVES;DOS SANTOS, JEEVES LOPES

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: This paper presents a solution to the problem of how to coordinate the actuators of a four legged robot with free wheels on its feet considering multiple criteria. It is assumed that the position of each leg actuator is described by a periodic function that has to be determined using a reinforcement learning technique. Analysis of the robot morphology is used to group similar legs and decrease the number of actuator functions that must be determined. MATLAB/Simulink and the SimMechanics Toolbox are used to simulate the robot gait. The simulated robot response is evaluated by the reinforcement learning technique considering: 1) the robot frontal speed, 2) the smoothness of the robot movements, 3) the largest torque required by all actuators, and 4) the energy consumption. After the reinforcement learning algorithm converges to a solution, the actuators functions are applied to the real robot that was built using the Bioloid Comprehensive Kit, an educational robot kit manufactured by Robotis. The response of the real robot is then evaluated and compared with the simulated robot response. The solution obtained by the proposed methodology are presented and shown to be satisfactory.
INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS-INGLES: This paper presents a solution to the problem of how to coordinate the actuators of a four legged robot with free wheels on its feet considering multiple criteria. It is assumed that the position of each leg actuator is described by a periodic function that has to be determined using a reinforcement learning technique. Analysis of the robot morphology is used to group similar legs and decrease the number of actuator functions that must be determined. MATLAB/Simulink and the SimMechanics Toolbox are used to simulate the robot gait. The simulated robot response is evaluated by the reinforcement learning technique considering: 1) the robot frontal speed, 2) the smoothness of the robot movements, 3) the largest torque required by all actuators, and 4) the energy consumption. After the reinforcement learning algorithm converges to a solution, the actuators functions are applied to the real robot that was built using the Bioloid Comprehensive Kit, an educational robot kit manufactured by Robotis. The response of the real robot is then evaluated and compared with the simulated robot response. The solution obtained by the proposed methodology are presented and shown to be satisfactory.

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-TRABALHO.TITULO-DO-TRABALHO: Steering a quadruped robot: Simulation and experimental results

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-ARTIGO: Coordenao dos atuadores das pernas de robs mveis usando aprendizado por reforo: simulao e implementao
DADOS-BASICOS-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-ARTIGO-INGLES: Coordenao dos atuadores das pernas de robs mveis usando aprendizado por reforo: simulao e implementao

AUTORES.NOME-PARA-CITACAO: SANTOS, Jeeves L.;LOPES DOS SANTOS, JEEVES;DOS SANTOS, JEEVES LOPES

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: Este artigo apresenta uma soluo para o problema de coordenao dos atuadores das pernas de robs mveis com o objetivo principal de maximizar a sua velocidade frontal. assumido que a posio no tempo de cada atuador descrita por uma funo peridica que deve ser determinada de forma iterativa por um algoritmo de aprendizado por reforo. As pernas similares do rob so identificadas e agrupadas visando diminuir o nmero de funes que precisam ser determinadas. O toolbox SimMechanics do software MATLAB/Simulink usado para simular o caminhar do rob em uma superfcie plana. O desempenho do rob simulado medido considerando: a) a velocidade frontal e a suavidade na locomoo do rob, e b) o mximo torque e o consumo de energia dos atuadores. As funes que foram determinadas no ambiente de simulao pelo algoritmo de reforo so ento usadas nos atuadores do rob real construdo usando o kit de robtica educacional Bioloid Comprehensive Kit. O desempenho do rob real ento medido e comparado com o desempenho do rob simulado. Este artigo apresenta dois estudos de caso: um rob quadrpede e um trpode. Nos dois casos os robs possuem trs atuadores por perna. As solues obtidas pela aplicao do mtodo proposto so apresentadas e se mostraram satisfatrias.
INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS-INGLES: This article presents a solution to the problem of how to coordinate the actuators of a legged robot such that its frontal speed is maximized. It is assumed that the position of each leg actuator is described by a periodic function that has to be determined using a reinforcement learning technique called Learning Automata. Analysis of the robot morphology is used to group similar legs and decrease the number of actuator functions that must be determined. MATLAB/Simulink and the SimMechanics Toolbox are used to simulate the robot walking on a flat surface. The simulated robot response is evaluated by the reinforcement learning technique considering: 1) the robot frontal speed, 2) the smoothness of the robot movements, 3) the largest torque required by all actuators, and 4) the energy consumption. After the reinforcement learning algorithm converges to a solution, the actuators functions are applied to the real robot that was built using the Bioloid Comprehensive Kit, an educational robot kit manufactured by Robotis. The response of the real robot is then evaluated and compared with the simulated robot response. This article presents two case studies: a quadrupedal robot and a tripedal robot. In both cases, each leg has three actuators. The solutions obtained by the proposed methodology are presented and shown to be satisfactory.
